document.docAuthor: Liang, Tang, Zhao, Yun-Long & Puthz, Volker
document.masterDocTitle: Six new Stenus species of the cirrus group (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae) from China with a key to species of the group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new Stenus species of the cirrus group (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae) from China with a key to species of the group

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Stenus
species of the
cirrus
group

paragraph.keyLead:
3 Elytra unicolorous; front narrower (FW: HW = 0.42 ). Spermatheca as in
Fig. 13
(in
Puthz 2003
). Male unknown. BL: 3.0– 4.2 mm . China : Hainan
........................................................... S. fellowesi
Puthz, 2003

4 Forebody with interstices reticulately sculptured; pronotum and elytra slightly glossy with punctation very dense; abdominal punctation moderately coarse. Spermatheca as in
Fig. 14
(in
Puthz 2003
). Male unknown. Bl: 3.0– 4.2 mm . China : Hainan
....................................................... S. hainanensis
Puthz, 2003

- Forebody with interstices smooth; pronotum and elytra glossy with punctation less dense; abdominal punctation fine to very fine. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 6
(in
Puthz 1981
). BL: 4.0–5.0 mm. Vietnam ...............
.......................................................................................................................... S. echiniventris
Puthz, 1981
7 Elytral punctures distinctly delimited, moderately deep; punctation of frons coarse and moderately dense 8

- Elytral punctures indistinctly delimited, shallow; punctation of frons less coarse, sparse. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 1
, E (in
Naomi 1988
); spermatheca as in
Fig. 1
, F (in
Naomi 1988
). BL: 3.0– 3.8 mm . Japan : Amami- Oshima Is. ........................................................................................................
S. amamiensis
Naomi, 1988

8 Male
: aedeagus as in
Fig. 1
, D (in
Naomi 1998
), apical portion of median lobe triangular, longer than broad. BL: 3.0– 3.8 mm . Japan : Nansen Isls.: Toku Is............................................
S. tokunis
Naomi, 1998

- Male: aedeagus as in Fig. C (in
Naomi 1988
), apical portion of median lobe spade-like, broader than long. BL: 3.2–4.1 mm . Japan : Okinawa-Hontô Is.
........................................................ S. punctifer
Naomi, 1988

- Larger species, elytra at least as long as wide. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 12
(in
Puthz 1998 a
), spermatheca as in
Fig. 5
(in
Puthz 1998 a
). BL: 3.2–4.2 mm . Vietnam ..........................................
S. deliculus
Ryvkin, 1992

10 Punctation of forebody moderately dense, interstices strongly glossy, punctures distinctly delimited. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 26
(in
Puthz 2003
). BL: 2.5–3.5 mm . China : Jiangsu
.......... S. falsus
L. Benick, 1940
- Punctation of forebody very dense, interstices slightly or not glossy, punctures less distinctly delimited .. 11

11 Interstices of pronotal punctation distinctly reticulate. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 22
, spermatheca as in
Fig. 24
. BL: 2.3–2.8 mm . China : Zhejiang .........................................................................
S. shenshanjiai
sp. nov.

- Interstices of pronotal punctation indistinctly reticulate. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 10
(in Tang et al . 2005 ), spermatheca as in
Fig. 11
(in Tang et al . 2005 ). BL: 2.3–3.2 mm . China : Shaanxi ............................................
.......................................................................................................................... S. nigritus
Tang et al ., 2005

13 Frons with punctation sparse and different in size. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 12
(in
Puthz 2003
). BL: 3.0–4.0 mm. China : Guangdong
..................................................................................... S. cactiventris
Puthz, 2003

14 Punctation of pronotum and elytra very dense, crowded, that of the pronotum irregular. Species best identified by their sexual characters ................................................................................................................ 15

16 Elytral spot shorter, not extending towards shoulder. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 9
, spermatheca as in
Fig. 11
. BL: 3.7 –5.0 mm. China : Zhejiang
...................................................................................... S. zhulilongi
sp. nov

- Elytral spot longer, extending towards shoulder. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 20
(in
Puthz 2003
), spermatheca as in
Fig. 19
(in
Puthz 2003
). BL: 3.5–4.7 mm . China : Fujian.............................
S. lacrimulus
L. Benick, 1942

17 Elytral spot shorter than half elytron length. Punctation of pronotum homogenous, very coarse. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 18
. BL: 3.7 –5.0 mm. China : Zhejiang .................................................
S. jiulongshanus
sp. nov.

keyLead.keyStep:
18 Body smaller, punctation of pronotum inhomogenous, with moderately coarse and very coarse punctures. Aedoeagus as in
Fig. 18
(in
Puthz 2003
). BL: 3.6–4.3 mm . China : Fujian
........... S. wuyiensis
Puthz, 2003

paragraph.keyLead:
- Body larger, punctation of pronotum homogenous, very coarse. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 14
. BL: 3.8 –5.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
China : Jiangxi, Zhejiang
................................................................................................ S. lijinweni
sp. nov.
19 Punctation on elytral spot very sparse, some interstices larger than diameter of punctures. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 9
(in
Puthz 2003
). BL: 3.2–4.2 mm . China : Fujian....................................
S. cooterianus
Puthz, 2003

paragraph.keyLead: - Punctation on elytral spot dense, interstices slightly larger than half diameter of punctures.................... 20

20 Body larger: 3.8–4.5 mm (forebody: 1.9–2.1 mm ). Elytral spot longer than half elytron, extending towards shoulder. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 14
(in Tang et al . 2005 ), spermatheca as in
Fig. 15
(in Tang et al . 2005 ). BL: 4.1–4.7 mm . China : Zhejiang
........................................................................... S. ovalis
Tang et al ., 2005

- Body smaller: 3.2–4.1 mm (forebody: 1.6–1.7 mm ). Elytral spot shorter than half elytron length, not extending towards shoulder. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 6
(in Tang et al . 2005 ), spermatheca as in
Fig. 7
(in Tang et al . 2005 ). BL: 3.6–4.3 mm . China : Hubei .....................................................
S. andoi Tang et al ., 2005

21 Head scarcely wider than elytra; elytra broader than long; elytral spot indistinctly delimited. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 1
(in
Puthz, 1983
). BL: 3.0– 3.5 mm . China : Guangxi
.......................... S. splendidulus
Puthz, 1983

22 Elytral spot very large, extending towards shoulder (
Fig. 1
in
Hromádka 2001
)...................................... 23

- Elytral spot smaller, not extending towards shoulder. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 2
(in
Puthz 1998 b
). BL: 3.8–4.8 mm . Vietnam
.................................................................................................... S. aeneofulgens
Puthz, 1998

23 Punctation of elytra very dense, crowded. Abdominal punctation denser, interstices on 7 th tergite at most twice as wide as punctures. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 2
(in
Hromádka 2001
), spermatheca as in
Fig. 4
(in
Hromádka 2001
). BL: 3.7–4.7 mm . India : Uttar Pradesh
............................. S. panthera
Hromádka, 2001

- Punctation of elytra less dense, not crowded. Abdominal punctation sparser, interstices on 7 th tergite three times as wide as punctures........................................................................................................................ 24

- Body larger: longer than 3.4 mm ................................................................................................................... .... Seven Japanese species:
S. cirriformis
Naomi, 1988
;
S. domburi
Hromádka, 1979
;
S. kanzeon
Naomi, 2004
;
S. longisetosus
Puthz, 1993
;
S. nachiensis
Puthz, 2001
;
S. nyorin
Naomi, 2004
;
S. sakaii
Naomi & Puthz, 1996
;
S. sawadaianus
Hromádka, 1979
;
S. sugiei
Naomi, 1997
.

26 Elytra strongly glossy with punctation irregular, slightly confluent, interstices smooth. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 16
(in
Puthz 2003
), spermatheca as in
Fig. 15
(in
Puthz 2003
). BL: 2.6–3.4 mm . China : Jiangxi .......
................................................................................................................ S. huangganmontium
Puthz, 2003
- Elytra slightly glossy with punctation regular and deep, scarcely confluent............................................. 27

27 Frons nearly dull with punctation very dense. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 37
, spermatheca as in
Fig. 39
. BL: 2.6– 3.6 mm . China : Zhejiang ....................................................................................
S. cirrus
L. Benick, 1940

- Frons glossy with punctation sparse. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 1
, D (in
Naomi 1988
), spermatheca as in
Fig. 1
, E (in
Naomi 1988
). BL: 2.6–3.2 mm . Japan
.............................................. S. yashiro
Naomi & Puthz, 1994

28 Body broader and larger. Punctation of 6 th and 7 th abdominal tergites denser, interstices at most as large as punctures. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 27
, spermatheca as in
Fig. 29
. BL: 3.7–5.7 mm . China : Sichuan ...........
...................................................................................................................................... S. flammeus
sp. nov.

- Body narrower and slightly smaller. Punctation of 6 th and 7 th abdominal tergites less dense, interstices up to twice as large as punctures. Aedeagus as in
Fig. 32
, spermatheca as in
Fig. 34
.BL: 4.0– 4.5 mm . China : Sichuan
....................................................................................................................... S. bostrychus
sp. nov.
